a.h1: Farmington Central CUSD #265 Preparing Locally, Excelling Globally, To Build a Stronger Community

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

br.p: *Entire campus, inclusive of walking path, stadium & ball fields, is closed until further notice.
*Non-key personnel of the district are strongly encouraged to limit their accessing of campus.
*Key personnel are expected to practice social distancing and good personal hygiene to the utmost of their ability.

div.p: Congratulatons to Farmington Central HS Cheer Coach, Kim Pillman on being awarded the 2020 ICCA Coach of the Year! Coach Pillman was to receive this award at the ICCA Conference in March, but the conference was cancelled. Kara Bent, representing the ICCA, was able to present this award to Coach Pillman at her home, and it was also broadcast on a Zoom meeting. The FCHS Competitive Cheer Team had an extremely successful season. In the 2019-20 season, the Farmers claimed a 1st place finish in all 5 Competitive Cheer Invitationals they attended. In addition, the Farmers claimed the ICCA State Championship. To close the season, Coach Pillman's Cheerleaders earned the 2020 IHSA Small Division Runner-Up finish. The Cheerleaders had a very successful season. Congratulations Coach Pillman on a fantastic season and the 2020 ICCA Coach of the Year Award! https://youtu.be/CSil9C4KOFw

We’re excited to open the 2020-2021 school year application process for FCJHS Student Council! All current 5th, 6th, and 7th graders are invited to apply via the Google form located at the end of this email. If you need a paper copy, please contact Miss Clayton at cclayton@dist265.com or Mrs. Lettow at nlettow@dist265.com.
Important Dates:
Monday, April 20 - Application Process Opens
Friday, April 24 - Application Process Closes at Midnight
Monday, April 27 - 2020-2021 StuCo Members will be Announced
Tuesday, April 28 - Full Council Meeting (all current council and new members) via Zoom @ 2 PM
We’ve attached a two-page document that gives specific, detailed information about FCJHS Student Council. Please contact us if you have any questions.
FCJHS Student Council’s focus is on leadership, service, student voice, and engagement for the entire student body. Even though the conditions we are currently facing are far from ideal, we continue to work to improve the culture and climate of FCJHS.
Thank you,
Miss Clayton and Mrs. Lettow
FCJHS StuCo Advisors

Application Form: https://forms.gle/XdMonvioU6GuyL6k6
(Applications may be edited after they are submitted. No changes may be made after the deadline.)

Reminder that FCHS will take part in the #BeTheLight movement tonight. The stadium lights at FCHS will be turned on from 8-8:20pm. Please feel free to drive by the school on N. Lightfoot Rd, but be aware the campus is closed, including the parking lots.

Farmington Central HS will take part in the #BeTheLight movement this Friday, April 17. The lights at the Farmington District Stadium will be turned on from 8-8:20pm to show support for our school, our community, and the class of 2020.
